lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/alterego.AlterEgo.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run alterego.AlterEgo.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* The main class for the AlterEgo chatbot application.
* AlterEgo is a task management chatbot that helps users track todos, deadlines, and events.
* Constructs an AlterEgo chatbot instance with the specified file path for data storage.
* @param filePath the path to the file where tasks are stored.
* This method displays a welcome message, then continuously reads user input,
* parses and executes commands, until the user inputs "bye".
* Main method to start the process. creates a new AlterEgo instance and runs the process.
* Custom exception for AlterEgo application errors.
* Creates an exception with the given error message.
* @param message error message to display to user
* Enumeration of all available commands in AlterEgo.
* Creates a new Parser, initializing exit loop as false.
* Parses and executes a user command. Calls methods in taskList.
* @param taskList task list to operate on
public void execute(String input, TaskList taskList) throws AlterEgoException {
throw new AlterEgoException("Error: you didn't input the description??");
throw new AlterEgoException("Error: you didn't input the description??");
throw new AlterEgoException("Error: you didn't input the deadline. "
throw new AlterEgoException("Error: you didn't input the description??");
throw new AlterEgoException("Error: you fail to input the timing. "
+ "Use '/from' to indicate the start and '/to' to indicate the end");
throw new AlterEgoException("I don't understand that. Use 'help' to get the list of commands.");
* Checks if exit command has been received.
* @return true if user entered "bye", false otherwise
* Handles file storage operations for tasks.
* Set a file corresponding to the path as the storage.
* @param path file path for storing tasks
* Clears all tasks from storage file.
* Overwrites storage file with current task list/state.
* @param tasks list of tasks to save
* Appends a single task to storage file.
* @param task task to append to file
* @return list of loaded tasks, empty if file doesn't exist
* Represents a Deadline task with a due date.
* @param date due date for the deadline
* Converts deadline to format for file storage.
* @return formatted string for saving to file
* Compares this deadline with another object for equality.
* Two deadlines are equal if they have same description, done status, and date.
* Returns hash code based on task description, done status, and date.
* Represents an Event task with start and end dates.
* @param fromDate start date of the event
* @param toDate end date of the event
public Event(String taskName, LocalDate fromDate, LocalDate toDate) {

* Converts event to format for file storage.
* @return formatted string for saving to file
* Format: "[E][X/""] description (from: MMM d yyyy to: MMM d yyyy)"
* Compares this event with another object for equality.
* Two events are equal if they have same description, done status, and dates.
* Returns hash code based on task description, done status, and dates.
* Abstract base class for all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a task with the given name, initially not done.
* Marks this task as not done.
* @return true if task is done, false otherwise
* Converts task to file storage format.
* Formats a date as "MMM d yyyy" (e.g., "Mar 15 2024").
* Compares this task with another object for equality.
* Two tasks are equal if they have same description and done status.

* Returns hash code based on task description and done status.
* This method (including overriden one) is AI-generated

* Adds a todo task to the list, then saves the task to storage.
* @param taskName description of the todo task
Ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:\n "

throw new AlterEgoException("There's only " + tasks.size() + " tasks here!");
Ui.show("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n " + currTask);
